==Events==
* [[335]] &ndash; [[Dalmatius|Flavius Dalmatius]] is raised to the rank of [[Caesar (title)|Caesar]] by his uncle, emperor [[Constantine the Great|Constantine I]].
* [[634]] &ndash; [[Siege of Damascus (634)|Siege of Damascus]]: The [[Rashidun army|Rashidun Arabs]] under [[Khalid ibn al-Walid]] capture [[Damascus]] from the [[Byzantine Empire]].
*[[1356]] &ndash; [[Battle of Poitiers]]: An English army under the command of [[Edward, the Black Prince]] defeats a French army and captures the French king, [[John II of France|John II]].
*[[1676]] &ndash; [[Jamestown, Virginia|Jamestown]] is burned to the ground by the forces of [[Nathaniel Bacon (colonist)|Nathaniel Bacon]] during [[Bacon's Rebellion]]. 
*[[1692]] &ndash; [[Giles Corey]] is [[Pressing (execution)|pressed to death]] after refusing to [[plea]]d in the [[Salem witch trials]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: British forces win a tactically expensive victory over the [[Continental Army]] in the [[Battles of Saratoga|First Battle of Saratoga]].
*[[1778]] &ndash; The [[Continental Congress]] passes the first [[United States federal budget]].
*[[1796]] &ndash; [[George Washington's Farewell Address]] is printed across America as an open letter to the public.
*[[1799]] &ndash; [[French Revolutionary Wars]]: French-Dutch victory against the Russians and British in the [[Battle of Bergen (1799)|Battle of Bergen]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; Two French shepherd children, [[Mélanie Calvat]] and [[Maximin Giraud]], experience a [[Marian apparition]] on a mountaintop near [[La Salette, Isère|La Salette]], France, now known as [[Our Lady of La Salette]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Iuka]] &ndash; [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] troops under General [[William Rosecrans]] defeat a [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] force commanded by General [[Sterling Price]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Chickamauga]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; Spanish revolution: [[Glorious Revolution (Spain)|La Gloriosa]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]]: the [[Siege of Paris (1870–71)|Siege of Paris]] begins, which will result on [[January 28]], [[1871]] in the surrender of Paris and a decisive [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussian]] victory.
*  1870   &ndash; Having invaded the [[Papal States]] a week earlier, the Italian Army lays siege to Rome, entering the city the next day, after which the Pope described himself as a [[Prisoner in the Vatican]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; The [[Blackpool Illuminations]] are switched on for the first time.
*[[1881]] &ndash; U.S. President [[James A. Garfield]] dies of wounds suffered in a July 2 shooting.
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[Women's suffrage]]: in New Zealand, the Electoral Act of 1893 is consented to by the [[governor]] giving all women in New Zealand the [[right to vote]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Bruno Hauptmann]] is arrested for the [[Lindbergh kidnapping|kidnapping and murder of Charles Lindbergh, Jr.]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Kępa Oksywska]] concludes, with Polish losses reaching roughly 14% of all the forces engaged.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Witold Pilecki]] is voluntarily captured and sent to [[Auschwitz]] in order to smuggle out information and start a [[Jewish resistance during the Holocaust#Resistance in the concentration camps|resistance]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Moscow Armistice|Armistice]] between Finland and [[Soviet Union]] is signed. (End of the [[Continuation War]]).
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Battle of Hürtgen Forest]] between United States and [[Nazi Germany]] begins.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Lord Haw-Haw]] ([[William Joyce]]) is sentenced to death in London.
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[Council of Europe]] is founded following a speech by [[Winston Churchill]] at the [[University of Zurich]].
*  [[1952]] &ndash; The United States bars [[Charlie Chaplin]] from re-entering the country after a trip to England.
*[[1957]] &ndash; First American underground [[Nuclear testing|nuclear bomb test]] (part of [[Operation Plumbbob]]).
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Nikita Khrushchev]] is barred from visiting [[Disneyland Park (Anaheim)|Disneyland]] due to security concerns.
*[[1970]] &ndash; The first [[Glastonbury Festival]] is held at [[Michael Eavis]]'s farm in [[Glastonbury]], United Kingdom.  
*  1970   &ndash; [[Kostas Georgakis]], a Greek student of [[geology]], sets himself ablaze in Matteotti Square in [[Genoa]], Italy, as a protest against the [[Greek military junta of 1967–1974|dictatorial regime]] of [[Georgios Papadopoulos]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Montagnard (Vietnam)|Montagnard]] [[ARVN|troops of South Vietnam]] revolt against the rule of [[Nguyễn Khánh]], killing 70 [[Vietnamese people|ethnic Vietnamese]] soldiers. 
*[[1972]] &ndash; A [[parcel bomb]] sent to [[Israel]]i Embassy in London kills one [[diplomat]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; King [[Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden]] has his investiture.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Turkish Airlines Flight 452]] hits the [[Taurus Mountains]], outskirt of [[Karatepe]], [[Osmaniye]], [[Turkey]], killing all 154 passengers and crew.
*  1976   &ndash; Two [[Imperial Iranian Air Force]] [[F-4 Phantom II]] jets fly out to [[1976 Tehran UFO incident|investigate an unidentified flying object]] when both independently lose instrumentation and communications as they approach, only to have them restored upon withdrawal.
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[Solomon Islands]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Simon & Garfunkel]] reunite for a free concert in New York's Central Park.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Scott Fahlman]] posts the first documented [[emoticon]]s :-) and :-( on the [[Carnegie Mellon University]] [[Bulletin Board System]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Saint Kitts and Nevis]] gains its independence.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[1985 Mexico City earthquake|A strong earthquake]] kills thousands and destroys about 400 buildings in Mexico City.
*  1985   &ndash; [[Tipper Gore]] and other political wives form the [[Parents Music Resource Center]] as [[Frank Zappa]] and other musicians testify at [[United States Congress|U.S. Congressional hearings]] on obscenity in [[rock music]].
*[[1989]] &ndash; A [[terrorist]] bomb explodes [[UTA Flight 772]] in mid-air above the Tùnùrù Desert, [[Niger]], killing 171.
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Ötzi the Iceman]] is discovered by German tourists.
*[[1995]] &ndash; The ''[[Washington Post]]'' and ''[[The New York Times]]'' publish the [[Unabomber]]'s manifesto.
*[[1997]] &ndash; [[Guelb El-Kebir massacre]] in [[Algeria]]; 53 killed.
*[[2006]] &ndash; The [[Thailand|Thai]] military [[2006 Thai coup d'état|stages a coup]] in [[Bangkok]]. The [[Constitution of Thailand|Constitution]] is revoked and [[martial law]] is declared.
*[[2010]] &ndash; The leaking oil well in the [[Deepwater Horizon oil spill|''Deepwater Horizon'' oil spill]] is sealed.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Mariano Rivera]] of the [[New York Yankees]] surpasses [[Trevor Hoffman]] to become [[Major League Baseball]]'s all time [[Save (baseball)|saves]] leader with 602.
*[[2013]] &ndash; Disney closes 3 of its MMO games, [[Toontown Online]], [[Pirates of the Caribbean Online]], and [[Pixie Hollow Online]]
